meanings.definition: To chill or cool something in advance.
meanings.sent1: I always prechill the water before adding it to the fish tank.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for prechilling the dough before baking.
meanings.sent3: The chef prechilled the ingredients, but the oven was too hot!
meanings.sent4: Her icy stare prechilled the room, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The prechilling wind made me shiver uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: The act of chilling or cooling something before use.
meanings.sent1: The prechilling of the drinks made the party more enjoyable.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to do the prechilling before starting the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The prechilling process was so efficient that the ice cream stayed frozen for hours.
meanings.sent4: The prechilling of the room created a refreshing atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The prechilling of the vegetables kept them fresh for the salad.
